definition: (onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain
splash/(onom.) for heavy things falling down
see 嘰哩咕嚕|叽哩咕噜[ji1 li5 gu1 lu1]
sound made by an empty stomach
sound made by an empty stomach

sentences.english: You can add plaid or even floral cushions to soften the effect if you want.
sentences.chinese: 您可以添加格布甚至花艺咕软化的影响，如果你想。

sentences.english: Also the opening ceremony of the new Gumi Music Journey was held in our pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 同时新的咕咪音乐之旅启动仪式也在我们馆举行。

sentences.english: They each found their favorite milk and drank it at once.
sentences.chinese: 他们都找到了自己喜欢的牛奶，立刻咕咚咚喝起来。

sentences.english: The glazed eyes stirred and Wu Sun - fu brought up a gobbet of phlegm.
sentences.chinese: 吴荪甫的眼珠动了，咕的吐出一堆浓痰。

sentences.english: The first time she went to Tomas's flat her insides began to rumble.
sentences.chinese: 她第一次去托马斯的寓所，体内就开始咕咕咕了。
阁楼上有咕咕哝哝的声音。

definition: move the mouth as in speaking
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
(onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
see 卟啉, porphyrin/see 卟吩, porphin
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
(onom.) quack/honk/(northern dialect) very/also pr. [ga1 ga5], [ga2 ga5] etc
